"The diagnosis rates of special conditions in general practice clinics and general pediatrics clinics in India is quite low. So patients are often referred to specialists quite late when the condition has already worsened. So it becomes important to enable general practice clinics with screening tools that can surface red flags for special conditions and alert the doctor. This must be accompanied by doctor-to-doctor specialist advice so local investigations and timely referrals can happen under expert advice. For straightforward cases, local treatment can happen under expert advice, with referrals limited to complicated cases. This benefits the patients with better outcomes due to early diagnosis and local treatment. It benefits the primary care clinic with patient retention, local investigations and local treatment, which add income to the clinic. It benefits specialists, too because they earn consultation fees from the doctor-to-doctor consultations (patient pays) and a referral pipeline for complicated cases. Inditech's screening tools and specialist advice systems cover many special conditions already and almost all specialties in pediatrics. Pharma brands also participate in Inditech programs (over 60 brands have done so so far) because Inditech programs help them to build superior value based relationships for the brands and their field representatives with doctors, which brands struggle with."

"General Practice clinics in India have the following problems-
Patients do not come to the clinic for timely intervention.
General practitioners are not able to diagnose or treat special conditions.
General practice clinics don't offer preventive, monitoring or management services for non-communicable diseases and chronic conditions.

We bring early detection and specialized capabilities to primary care clinics by-
Bringing education to doctors from leading experts and academies.
Bringing in-clinic education, screening tools, red-flag alerts, and doctor-to-doctor specialist advice.
Bringing specialized services to the clinic to prevent and manage chronic conditions.
Inditech delivers professional education for doctors from India's leading experts and is endorsed by medical academies. Inditech delivers education in all the standard formats-
certificate online education modules
online, offline and hybrid classroom education
workshops and case study clinics

Inditech enables practical use for the academy-endorsed education by extending it into general practice clinics for early detection and intervention. 
short format education on red flags for various special conditions, suitable for in-clinic distribution and consumption
Doctor-personalized multilingual patient screening tools, which report red flags to the doctors
Screening tools for use by the doctor to identify red flags 

Inditech makes practical education actionable as follows-
When a red flag is noticed, the general practice clinic will have a doctor-to-doctor specialist advice available to investigate and treat locally under expert advice or make a timely referral to the specialist.
Connect specialized digital therapeutics services to the general practice clinic to prevent, monitor and manage chronic conditions and non-communicable diseases.
Inditech leverages its vast and deep connections with experts and medical academies to create the above solutions, and works with pharma brands to distribute them to general practice clinics and also uses pharma companies to recruit specialists for the doctor-to-doctor specialist advice system.

Pharma brands in India spend most of their marketing and sales budgets on enhancing the quality of their relationships with doctors and specialists. They use these relationships to build brand equity, brand salience and brand loyalty in the community of doctors. But brands find building value-based relationships with doctors challenging because their field representatives could be more talented. Their value-based activities for doctors are mostly limited to hosting or sponsoring professional education events. In addition, there is a need for differentiation from competing pharma brands.

Inditech's solutions represent a win-win opportunity, wherein brands can partner with Inditechfor their therapy areas. They can become the distribution or promotion partners for Inditech's services for the doctors/clinics they target. They can also become the recruitment partner for specialists in specific therapy areas for a region. This helps them to bring high and differentiated value to the doctors. Inditech also benefits by revenue, where the pharma brand partner pays Inditech a fee for each doctor served under the partnership."

At Inditech, we recognize the challenges faced by general practice clinics in India, such as the inability to diagnose or treat special conditions and the lack of preventive, monitoring, or management services for non-communicable diseases and chronic conditions. To address these issues, we provide primary care clinics with advanced screening tools, education, and specialist advice, enhancing their capabilities and expanding their services.

Our comprehensive approach begins with professional education for doctors, delivered through certificate online education modules, classroom education, workshops, and case study clinics, all endorsed by leading experts and medical academies. We enable practical use of this education by providing short format education on red flags for various special conditions, doctor-personalized multilingual patient screening tools, and doctor-use screening tools to identify red flags within the clinics.

Inditech transforms practical education into actionable solutions. When a red flag is detected, our doctor-to-doctor specialist advice system connects general practice clinics with experts to investigate and treat locally under expert guidance, or make timely referrals to specialists. We also connect specialized digital therapeutics services to these clinics for preventing, monitoring, and managing chronic conditions and non-communicable diseases.

Our partnership with pharma brands further strengthens our offerings. These brands can distribute or promote Inditech's services, bringing high and differentiated value to the doctors they target. Additionally, pharma brands can recruit specialists for specific therapy areas, fostering a mutually beneficial relationship.

By integrating advanced screening tools, education, and specialist advice, Inditech empowers general practice clinics in India to provide early detection, intervention, and effective management of various health conditions. Together, we can transform the primary care landscape and improve patient outcomes. #Inditech #PrimaryCare #ScreeningTools

To ensure the acquired knowledge is easily applied in clinical settings, we offer short-format education on red flags for various special conditions, tailored for in-clinic distribution and consumption.

Our doctor-personalized multilingual patient screening tools and doctor-use screening tools allow healthcare professionals to identify red flags at the point of care. When a red flag is detected, Inditech's doctor-to-doctor specialist advice system ensures general practitioners have access to expert guidance for local investigation, treatment, or timely referrals to specialists.

Inditech's approach to CME enhances the practical value of professional education, enabling doctors to effectively detect, manage, and treat a wide range of conditions in their clinics, ultimately improving patient outcomes. #Inditech #ContinuingMedicalEducation #PracticalEducation
